discourse_list.title: Community Call: ERC1400 Introductions, Feedback, & Questions

content.content: The team that has submitted ERC1400 has agreed to do a community call to introduce the EIP, gather feedback, and talk through suggestions and questions.  When: Monday, Sept 17th, 7AM PDT world time  Where: Google Meet https://meet.google.com/zpf-whhr-kfm   Here is the agenda / notes document, please add yourself if you plan to attend, and add your questions there: https://hackmd.io/RexWNd_4S-K6zz53dlljJQ The introduction thread is here:     ERC-1400 and ERC-1410 - Security Token and Partially Fungible Token EIPs       Important update: after feedback, ERC-1400 (Security Token Standard) was split, so that now there is a related proposal ERC-1410 (Partially Fungible Token Standard).   From Adam Dossa, Pablo Ruiz @pabloruiz55, Fabian Vogelsteller @frozeman, Stephane Gosselin @thegostep:   Motivation Accelerate the issuance and management of securities on the Ethereum blockchain by specifying a standard interface through which security tokens can be operated on and interrogated by all relevant parties.  Security …     Thanks Adam Dossa @AdamDossa, Pablo Ruiz @pabloruiz55, Fabian Vogelsteller @frozeman, Stephane Gosselin @thegostep for the work so far! Please DO mention the questions you want to ask here in this thread as well as putting them into the notes call doc.
content.GPT-summary: The team behind ERC1400 is hosting a community call to introduce the EIP, gather feedback, and answer questions. They have split the proposal into two related proposals, ERC-1400 and ERC-1410. The post encourages attendees to add their questions to the notes document and to the thread.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: Thanks everyone who attended the call, thanks @AdamDossa @pabloruiz55 @thegostep for walking us through ERC1400. Great discussion. So, lessons learned:  lots more people will show up day of than have put their name in a HackMD doc   Google Meet has a 25 person limit (and that’s with my business account!) – Jitsi is a good open source option (which also supports YouTube Livestreaming) or Zoom  high interesting in security tokens!  The HackMD doc can continue to be used for notes / questions. Next Steps as listed in that doc:  New York Security Token Exchange is willing to host the discussion http://www.securitytoken.foundation  Use a different platform for holding the next call. Google meet limited us to only 25 participants. Zoom? Schedule regular calls, what should be the cadence? Meeting in Prague before Devcon. Added the topic to the call for rings on ETHMagicians: Council of Paris - HackMD  Setup Telegram / webpage for “alliance”  Anyone looking to join at Council of Prague will need to register here: https://www.picatic.com/ethmagicians-prague-2018 (currently waitlisted, but we’ll be making more tickets available later this week). Over to you, ERC1400 team – as I said on the call, you’re welcome to use forums here for discussion if you’d like.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

discourse_list.title: 2nd Community Call: ERC1400 Feedback, Discussion & Questions

content.content: We would like to have a second community call related to ERC1400 following on from the previous call documented at:     Community Call: ERC1400 Introductions, Feedback, & Questions Token Ring       The team that has submitted ERC1400 has agreed to do a community call to introduce the EIP, gather feedback, and talk through suggestions and questions.   When: Monday, Sept 17th, 7AM PDT world time  Where: Google Meet https://meet.google.com/zpf-whhr-kfm   Here is the agenda / notes document, please add yourself if you plan to attend, and add your questions there: https://hackmd.io/RexWNd_4S-K6zz53dlljJQ  The introduction thread is here:    Thanks Adam Dossa @AdamDossa, Pablo Ruiz @pabloruiz55,…      When: Tuesday, October 2nd, 11AM EST world time check Call Details: Zoom Join from PC, Mac, Linux, iOS or Android: https://zoom.us/j/963516600 Or iPhone one-tap : US: +16465588656,963516600#  or +16699006833,963516600# Or Telephone: Dial(for higher quality, dial a number based on your current location): US: +1 646 558 8656  or +1 669 900 6833 Meeting ID: 963 516 600 International numbers available: https://zoom.us/u/acB6ZYvJ6 Topics to discuss:  summary of main discussion points so far should the standard insist on backwards compatibility with ERC20 / ERC777 which parts of the standard should be split out as separate ERC’s initial set of ERC 1066 codes  Here is the agenda / notes document, please add yourself if you plan to attend, and add any items you’d like to discuss to the agenda: https://hackmd.io/lovcN0QXRpevkHSHrVFlYA The introduction thread is here:  ERC-1400 and ERC-1410 - Security Token and Partially Fungible Token EIPs Please DO mention the questions you want to ask here in this thread as well as putting them into the notes call doc.
content.GPT-summary: The post announces a second community call related to ERC1400, where the team behind the proposal will introduce the EIP, gather feedback, and answer questions. The post provides details on the date, time, and location of the call, as well as an agenda and notes document for attendees to add their questions and discussion points. The post also encourages attendees to mention their questions in the thread.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
